main_definition: To extend or lengthen something, either physically or metaphorically.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical extension of the body's muscles and joints.
meanings_and_examples.example: After sitting for a long time, she decided to stretch her arms and legs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make something longer or more extensive in space or duration.
meanings_and_examples.example: The marathon runners had to stretch their endurance as they continued running the race.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To increase the range of motion, flexibility, or capacity by applying force.
meanings_and_examples.example: Every morning, he stretches before starting his workout routine to warm up his muscles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A metaphorical stretch referring to an effort or attempt to achieve something difficult or beyond one's current abilities.
meanings_and_examples.example: She had a hard time studying for the exam, but she decided to give it her all and make a stretch towards success.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of elongating fabric by pulling at its edges while damp.
meanings_and_examples.example: After washing their clothes, they laid them out on a flat surface to stretch before hanging them up to dry.
